articles.title: About me
articles.description: All of these dashboards were created by me, Nathan Whitmore, a conservation scientist and practitioner. If you want to get in touch feel free to do so [here](https://nathanwhitmore.github.io/reproducible/contact.html).

articles.title: wildRtools
articles.description:
A hub for shiny dashboards focused on wildlife and environmental monitoring
(currently under construction)
articles.contents:
Contents
Population dynamics
Population projection matrices

eDNA
TICI dashboard
eDNA sample checker

Forestry
Intergenerational share valuation

Spatial
Spatial translator

Temporal
Gnomonic time setting
Acknowledgments
Code


This website contains a links to interactive shiny dashboards. All these dashboards have been licensed under an MIT license. You are free to access, reproduce, and edit the code under the terms of the license.
Population dynamics
Population projection matrices

Assess growth rates of species based on survival & fecundity
Draw life history diagrams
Project populations through time
Undertake diagnostics
Includes teaching material

eDNA
TICI dashboard

eDNA sample checker


Forestry
Intergenerational share valuation

Demonstrates how share valuation can be equalised across time
Useful for intergenerational equity

Spatial
Spatial translator

Change between spatial formats (csv, kml, gpx, and shp)
Switch coordinate reference system

Temporal
Gnomonic time setting

Set start and finish times based on location & sun position.
Works for low and medium latitudes
Useful for calibrating remote arrays

Acknowledgments
This website would not be possible with out the funding support from Auckland Council, Otago Regional Council, tools made by Posit especially the distill package.
Code
The final code used to render this page is available at https://github.com/NathanWhitmore/wildRtools
